intro: Platysace compressa, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Platysace compressa is often found in coastal dunes and inland sandy plains, contributing to the ecological stability of these environments.
